title: Linglong Tower (Yuanwu Town)
text:
Linglong Tower (), or Linglong Pagoda, also known as Hui Pagoda and Wild Goose Pagoda, is an ancient <a href="pagoda">pagoda</a> located in Yuanwu Town, 17 km southwest of <a href="Yuanyang%20County%2C%20Henan">Yuanyang County</a>. It is a planar hexagonal thirteen-story pavilion-style brick tower, with a height of 47 meters.
History.
Linglong Tower was originally a <a href="building">building</a> attached to the Shanhu Temple. It was built in the fourth year of the <a href="Song%20Dynasty">Song Dynasty</a> (1105), restored in the twenty-ninth year of the <a href="Ming%20Dynasty">Ming Dynasty</a> (1601). During the <a href="Jiaqing%20Emperor">Jiaqing Period</a> of the <a href="Qing%20Dynasty">Qing Dynasty</a> (1796-1820), the temple was destroyed by fire and only the pagoda survived.
In 1963, Linglong Tower was identified as a cultural relic protection unit in Henan Province. In March 2013, it was included in the seventh batch of <a href="Major%20Historical%20and%20Cultural%20Site%20Protected%20at%20the%20National%20Level">National Key Cultural Relics Protection Units in China</a>.
